availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James A. Cartwright (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Married to Adeline Graves in Winchester, Kentucky, in April 1817. Father of Mary Frances Cartwright O'Hara, Arabella Wall, Eliza Redd, Joseph Cartwright, Elizabeth E. Cartwright O'Hara, Serena M. Cartwright, Lucian J. Cartwright, Elvira A. Cartwright, and Milton A. Cartwright. Married to Mary A. J. Cartwright in Hopkins County, Kentucky. Owned seven enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1830. Owned seventeen enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1840.

ab.bibl:
Fifth Manuscript Census of the United States (1830), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, p. 140.
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, p. 46.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Clark County Marriages, Film #001943687, p. 724.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Caldwell County Administration Bonds, 1830-1869; Vol 19-20, 1970-1975 (accessed via Ancestry.com), probate no. 111, p. 1848.
